definition: can/may/able to/to approve/to permit/to suit/(particle used for emphasis) certainly/very

sentences.english: The members censured him since he had done a very contemptible thing.
sentences.chinese: 因爲他做了一件很可鄙的事情，會員們都責難他。

sentences.english: Unfortunately, there are a lot of people who still fall for such despicable mottos .
sentences.chinese: 不幸地，仍然有很多人們跌倒在這樣可鄙的座右銘前。

sentences.english: Bards will not spare breath upon your pitiful empire.
sentences.chinese: 吟遊詩人將不會在你那可鄙的王朝上多費口舌。

sentences.english: The most contemptible of the personages in the play is the courtly fop Osric.
sentences.chinese: 劇中最可鄙的人物是風度翩翩的花花公子奧斯里克。

sentences.english: His cowardice in face of the enemy was contemptible 7.
sentences.chinese: 他在敵人面前膽小如鼠，真是可鄙。

sentences.english: One who is selfish is contemptible .
sentences.chinese: 自私自利的人是可鄙的。

sentences.english: I gritted my teeth as I thought what a despicable thing it would be.
sentences.chinese: 想到這將是件非常可鄙的事，我就不禁咬緊牙關。

definition: sordid and contemptible (idiom); vile and repulsive (esp. character or action)
